conversation.content: I know this is. Um. Probably annoying but I just—I just need to understand what's covered.

Oh no, not annoying at all! *exhales* Honestly, insurance plans are confusing for everyone—I deal with them all day and still get mixed up sometimes. Let me pull up your policy number, it's showing as POL-4482-NK9, and we can go through everything together.
Thanks. Sorry it's—wait no, I mean—I'm just. Really tired of not knowing.

Mmm, I completely understand that exhaustion. So looking at your plan here... *soft breath* okay, you've got our Silver Plus coverage which has a $2,500 deductible, and then after that we cover 80% of most services until you hit your out-of-pocket maximum.
The the maximum is? God I should—sorry, I should know this.

Hey, no need to apologize—seriously, this stuff is intentionally complicated. Let me see here... your out-of-pocket max is $7,150 for the year, and hmm, looks like you've already met $1,823 of that so far.
Oh. Okay okay okay. So dental—no wait, is dental? Is dental part of this?

*sharp inhale* Ah, so dental is where it gets tricky. Your plan code SLV-PLUS-24 includes preventive dental only—so cleanings twice a year, basic X-rays—but fillings, crowns, that kind of thing would need separate coverage. What were you hoping to get done?
I think—no actually—just. Just a cleaning. Maybe.

Okay so that's good news then! Cleanings are fully covered, no copay. Hmm, and I can see... yeah, you haven't used either of your preventive visits this year, so you could schedule one anytime before December 31st.
Right. And vision is—sorry, the other—is vision separate too?

*soft exhale* Yeah, vision is also separate unfortunately. Let me check what you have... okay so your employer added basic vision as rider VIS-098, which gives you one exam per year plus $150 toward frames or contacts.
That's Tuesday—wait no, Wednesday. Wednesday they said something about mental health?

Ooh yes, mental health—that's actually where your plan is pretty decent. So with your coverage tier, therapy sessions have a $25 copay after you meet your deductible, and there's no visit limit which, honestly, is rare these days.
I'm sorry you have to. To explain all this. It's it's not your fault it's confusing.

Aw, you're really kind to say that. *breath* Look, between you and me? I think the whole system is backwards—we spend more time decoding coverage than actually helping people get care. Your confirmation number for this call is CNF-7739-XM if you need to reference anything we discussed.
Thanks. Um. Prescriptions. Are those?

Oh right, prescriptions! Let me see here... you've got a three-tier formulary, so generics are $10, preferred brands are $35, and non-preferred run about $75, though some specialty meds need prior auth through form PA-2847.
Okay. I just—I just want to. To know I'm covered if something happens.

*long exhale* I hear you, and that worry is so valid. Hmm, what if I email you a simplified breakdown? Not the legal document but like, a real person's guide to your coverage with our direct line 888-424-0931 if questions come up? Would that help ease some of that exhaustion?

scenario: trying to understand their coverage and what's included
